title: Coursework
text:
University of Chicago

FINM 25000 91: Quantitative Portfolio Management and Algorithmic Trading (Summer 2022)

title: Projects
text:
Most Active Stocks Price Predictions and Visualizations

Built the Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) model using TensorFlow to predict prices of the most active traded stocks
Created an interactive app using Plotly Dash to display historical prices and future predictions with user-specified technical indicators

IMDb Movie Review Sentiment Classification

Deployed four machine learning methods - K-Nearest Neighbors (KNN), Random Forest, Logistic Regression, and Support Vector Machine (SVM) - to analyze the binary classification for 50,000 IMDb movie reviews

2023 ASA DataFest at UCLA

Analyze a dataset of 400K question posts from the American Bar Association (ABA) and provide recommendations on improving its pro bono legal services within 48 hours
Applied Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Sentiment Analysis to analyze posts’ clarity and clients’ satisfaction
Team won Don Ylvisaker Best Insight Honorable Mention

title: Projects
text:
Consulting
Amigos de los Rios Endowment Plan & Value Statement

Aimed to help Amigo de los Rios, an environmental conservation nonprofit, improve its funding availability
Conducted thorough market research and competitive analyses to recommended establishing a quasi-endowment fund and implementing successful tactics from other NGOs

title: Projects
text:
Finance
MP Materials Investment Case

Developed investment report and strategic consideration for MP Materials through conducting industry and company due diligence, listening to earnings calls, and analyzing SEC filings
Built 10-year scenario-based three statement financial models with Wall Street estimates, and performed company valuation using discounted cash flow analysis and comparable trading multiple analysis

title: Bingyi (Joyce) Xu
text:
I am currently a senior at University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) double-majoring in Mathematics/Economics and Statistics & Data Science. I also aim to declare my Specialization in Computing before graduation. Majoring in these subjects helped me build a solid quantitative background and strengthened my logical thinking and data analysis skills.
I was very interested in business in general when I first entered college, so I further explored the field by actively participating in consulting clubs. I later discovered my more specific passion in finance through several internships related to factor investing and private equity.
Apart from my academic interests, I’m also actively involved in extracurricular clubs on campus related to professional development and volunteering. During my free time, I also like to sing and dance with my friends in a cappella groups and dance clubs.
Resume: Resume
